summary: Update Screen Scraper with AI and Puppeteer to Collect Pricing Data Since Major Changes to the Bedrock Pricing Dynamic HTML
description:
Value Statement
 * As a ML Engineer who calculates model invocation costs per 1000 input/output tokens from the Bedrock pricing web page, I need the ability to track Bedrock invocation costs from real-time/current model token pricing data so that I get accurate cost tracking and reporting to discern if users are over budget.

Acceptance Criteria
 * Develop and deploy a container running Node.js and Puppeteer to filter the dynamic HTML on 'AWS GovCloud'
 * Scrape the pricing data into the schema:

{code:java}
{
    "model_family": "Anthropic",
    "model_name": "Claude Sonnet 4",
    "price_per_1000_input_tokens": 0.003,
    "price_per_1000_output_tokens": 0.015
  }{code}
 * Version controlled pricing and model ID data is inserted into the PostgreSQL database from the Python API.
 * Documentation is updated here: Comments in Python code and high-level overview in README markdown document in the Git repository.
 * Automated or manual tests were added here: Automated integration tests.

Assumptions
None

Dependencies
 * None

Notes
 * Per our conversations with the client, the following information may be useful: The tenants will start using Bedrock model families other than Anthropic, including but limited to Meta Llama models.

Out of Scope
N/A

summary: Create data pipeline to refresh github file in s3
description:
As an MLE I want to create a data pipeline that will take the files from the GitHub repo for the BIP platform and refresh it into the knowledge base

AC:

A SageMaker pipeline to pull the files from GitHub. The pipeline will then put the files into the s3 knowledge base and resync the knowledge base

****
 # grab the github files and upload to the s3 bucket

Github repo:

[https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-platform-docs/tree/master/docs]

 

s3 bucket:

s3://project-bip-ai-dev-usgw1-core/bedrock/bippy/knowledgebase/

 

Knowledge base id: RPZNY9J6XY

 
 * duplicate files will be overwritten.
 * This process only copy .md files

summary: Ensure LCC is available and functional in all domains in preprod
description:
Value Statement

As a BIP AI Tenant who uses SageMaker Studio, I need the Lifecycle Configuration (LCC) to be available and working in my preprod domain so that my environment is set up correctly and consistently every time I launch Studio.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user launches SageMaker Studio in any preprod domain, the LCC is attached and functions as expected. The environment is configured automatically according to the LCC without manual intervention. Manual validation: Confirm LCC presence and correct environment setup in all preprod domains.

summary: Ensure LCC is available and functional in all domains in dev to ensure environment consistency
description:
Value Statement

As a BIP AI Tenant who uses SageMaker Studio, I need the Lifecycle Configuration (LCC) to be available and working in my dev domain so that my environment is set up correctly and consistently every time I launch Studio.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user launches SageMaker Studio in any dev domain, the LCC is attached and functions as expected. The environment is configured automatically according to the LCC without manual intervention. Manual validation: Confirm LCC presence and correct environment setup in all dev domains.

summary: Determine automated agent promotion strategy to increase consistency, efficiency, and reduce errors in releases
description:
Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages code promotion for tenants, I need the ability to define and document an automated strategy for promoting AWS Bedrock agent code from dev to preprod so that releases are consistent, efficient, and less error-prone.

Acceptance Criteria When a user reviews the documentation, there is a clear strategy for automated promotion of AWS Bedrock agent code from dev to preprod. The strategy includes recommended tools, workflows, and any prerequisites.

Manual validation: Confirm the strategy is documented and reviewed by the team.

summary: identify documentation in code that can be improved and fix it
description:
Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains platform code, I need to review and enhance in-code documentation in key repositories so that the codebase is easier to understand and maintain for all contributors.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user reviews the code in {-}bip-ai-kit{-}, tenant resources, or bip mlops template, in-code documentation (comments, docstrings) is clear, accurate, and helpful. Areas with missing or unclear documentation are identified and improved. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete: Manual review confirms in-code documentation is improved and up to date in all three repos.

summary: Clean up stale branches in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, mlops template repos so that the repositories remain organized and easy to maintain
description:

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages platform repositories, I need to identify and remove stale branches in key repos so that the repositories remain organized and easy to maintain.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user reviews the repos, stale or unused branches in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, and mlops template are identified and deleted as appropriate. No unnecessary or outdated branches remain in these repositories. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete: Manual review confirms stale branches have been cleaned up.

summary: Update READMEs in relevant repos to ensure clear and relevant documentation
description:
Title

Update READMEs in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, and bip mlops template repos for clear and up-to-date documentation Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains platform resources, I need the documentation in key repositories to be clear, intuitive, and current so that users can easily understand and use the resources without confusion.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user reviews the README in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, or bip mlops template, the documentation is clear, accurate, and up to date. Outdated or unclear information is revised or removed. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete: Manual review confirms all README files are clear, intuitive, and reflect the latest platform standards.

summary: Find and remove mlmats references in relevant repos so that terminology is consistent
description:
Title: Remove mlmats references from BIP AI repos for consistency Value Statement

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains platform code and documentation, I need the ability to find and remove all references to "mlmats" in BIP AI repositories so that terminology is consistent across all code and documentation.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user searches the repos, all instances of "mlmats" are identified and replaced with "BIP AI" or the appropriate current term. No outdated "mlmats" references remain in code, documentation, or configuration files. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete: Manual review or automated search confirms all references have been updated for consistency.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user completes the audit, they have a summary of current pytest coverage and identified gaps in the mlkit, tenant resources, and mlops template repositories. Recommendations for additional tests are documented and shared with the team. Manual validation: Review audit findings and confirm recommendations are actionable.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user launches the SageMaker Studio code editor, the updated LCC is automatically applied for a ready-to-use environment. The LCC changes address issues or improvements identified in previous investigations. Documentation is updated here: [link to LCC or environment setup documentation] Manual validation: Confirm the updated LCC is applied and the environment is configured as expected for tenants.

summary: Create Prompt Library for AI-Assisted Test Case Generation to quickly generate cases for code using GitHub Copilot
description:
As a developer working on BIP AI, I need to create a reusable prompt library for test generation So that I can quickly generate accurate test cases for my code using GitHub Copilot or any integrated LLM Without manually crafting prompts each time.

Acceptance Criteria: When a developer opens the testing repository, they can find a prompt-library/folder containing multiple tested prompt templates.

Each prompt template includes: A short description of its intended use An example snippet of code to pair with the prompt Guidance on how to paste and use it with GitHub Copilot The prompt library includes templates for: Unit testing Python functions API endpoint testing with pytest Edge case generation A README.md in the prompt library explains how to use the prompts, where to paste them, and which tools they’re optimized for.

Impact Statement: Enables all tenants and engineers on BIP AI to accelerate test development Maintains quality and improves onboarding by providing standard prompt templates ready for AI-assisted workflows

summary: Detach PVC creation from mlflow chart to ensure immutable storage outside of helm chart
description:
As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want my MLFlow instance to have immutable storage via a PVC that is not part of the helm chart so it remains if the chart is uninstalled.

- When we deploy MLFlow for tenants, then the PVC should be created/managed by Crossplane and detached from the helm chart so that if the chart has to be replaced/uninstalled the storage remains which keeps the MLFlow instances ephemeral without losing storage.

summary: Prototype using Crossplane Grafana provider in local environment to allow dashboards to be deployed using IaC and Automation
description:
As an infra engineer I need to research and protype using the Grafana crossplane provider , so that dashboards can be deployed using IaC and Automation

A/C:

- Setup a local instance of grafana

- Deploy the Grafana crossplane provider https://marketplace.upbound.io/providers/grafana/provider-grafana/v0.30.0 - Use the grafana provider deploy an dashboard to your local grafana instance

summary: Configure JupyterLabApp / CodeEditor autoshutdown in sagemaker-domain composition to enhance cost saving and resource utilization
description:
As a tenant of BIP-AI, I need my JupyterLab and CodeEditor apps to automatically shutdown when idle for too long to save on costs.

A/C:
 * When a Jupyter Lab or CodeEditor app is left idle for 120 minutes, then it should automatically shutdown.
 * - When we need to manage the autoshutdown and idle configuration for JupyterLab Apps and CodeEditor then it should be done via IaC. This should be part of the default Sagemaker Domain configuration in the XSagemakerDomain composition so it applies to all domains. The parameter should be adjustable via the claim, but default to 120 minutes.

summary: Research IaC Providers for Bedrock (Crossplane/Terraform) to support self-service Agents and Knowledge Bases
description:
As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want to be able to provision Bedrock Agents and Knowledge Bases.
 * When tenants want to provision Bedrock Agents and KBs then we should have a self-service method which requires the use of IaC. We need to research the available providers for Crossplane and/or Terraform and test methods for deploying these resources.
 * - When we decide on the way forward, then we should have a plan documented and possible alternatives like API calls/boto3 in Confluence as an ADR.

summary: Detach values for BIP-AI claims to allow values updates without a full deployment release
description:
As the BIP-AI team, I want to be able to deploy Crossplane claims for our application and domain resources with detached values from bip-ai-infrastructure to allow for easier updates without having to create releases.

- When our team deploys Crossplane claims then a helm template should exist in the bip-ai-infrastructure repository under the compositions or gateway app (depending on use-case) and allow for values to be detached coming from the bip-ai-infrastructure-values repository

summary: Create bip-ai tenants app to support migration from mlmats claims app
description:
As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want my Crossplane claims to be deployed via the BIP-AI tenant app until support exists for us to deploy our own claims to AI resources.
 - When a tenants claim is deployed, then it should be deployed via the BIP-AI tenants app in -tenant- tooling ArgoCD under the bip-ai AppSet.
 - To support this effort, we need to create the bip-ai-claims app
 - This ticket has a follow-on to prototype and develop a migration script that handles moving claims safely.

Acceptance Criteria

Assumption We'll get accounts detail next sprint from request [https://jira.devops.va.gov/servicedesk/customer/portal/89/ICMO-2421]

Note We'll need to create a bip-ai-blue domain for internal testing (also for this WASA)

summary: Build Domain Access Wizard to consolidate support efforts
description:
As a BIP AI Gateway user, I want to be guided on how to gain access to a domain, so that I can request access without reaching out to BIP-AI support.

Acceptance Criteria
 * When a user logs into the gateway and doesn't see any domains, there will be new UI text saying "Don't see a domain? Click here for help"
 * - Clicking this text will bring up a wizard to guide users to BOSD to get the correct groups
 * - If a domain does appear (which means they have the correct role) but the user doesn't have a user profile, the connect button will become a "Request Access" button
 * - Clicking the "Request Access" button will pull up a wizard to submit a BIP-AI support ticket

summary: Add Logging from MLKit to SageMaker Model Lifecycle Notebook to Track Model Events
description:
*Value Statement:*
As a BIP AI tenant who develops models in SageMaker, I need the ability to integrate and utilize custom logging from the BIP AI library, MLKit, so that I can monitor and troubleshoot model events effectively across the lifecycle.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
When a user runs any stage of the SageMaker Model Lifecycle notebook (e.g., training, registration, deployment), the user has the ability to capture standardized logs using the BIP AI team's logger from MLKit.

summary: Enable Secure Configuration in SageMaker Model Lifecycle Notebook to Manage Parameters and Secrets
description:
*Value Statement:*
As a BIP AI tenant who runs workflows in SageMaker, I need the ability to securely retrieve configuration parameters and secrets from managed services so that I can avoid hardcoding values and protect sensitive information during model development and deployment.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
When a user runs any part of the SageMaker Model Lifecycle notebook, the user has the ability to retrieve parameters from AWS Systems Management Parameter Store and secrets from AWS Secrets Manager securely.

summary: Investigate manual pricing data updates for bedrock costing to provide interim cost tracking solution
description:
*Description:* As a BIP AI platform team, we need to investigate manual pricing data updates for the bedrock costing application to provide accurate cost tracking for our tenants while we develop a more robust programmatic solution. The current web scraping approach for AWS Bedrock pricing is unreliable due to frequent changes in AWS pricing page formats, causing delays in providing cost data to tenants who depend on this information for budget planning and usage monitoring.
*Value Statement:* This interim solution will enable us to quickly provide semi-accurate pricing data to tenants, ensuring business continuity for cost tracking while we invest time in developing a more sustainable long-term pricing solution. This approach reduces development overhead and allows us to maintain service reliability.
*Acceptance Criteria:* * *Given* the bedrock costing lambda is invoked, *when* it processes pricing data, *then* it should bypass the existing web scraping functionality and use manual pricing data stored in the database
 * *Given* recent GovCloud pricing data is available from AWS pricing pages, *when* the database is updated with manual pricing data, *then* it should contain current pricing for Amazon and Anthropic models filtered for GovCloud regions
 * *Given* manual pricing data needs to be deployed across environments, *when* database updates are required, *then* they should be packaged as SQL scripts located in the {{postgres-schema}} directory to simplify deployment to upper environments
 * *Given* the updated lambda code is deployed, *when* tested in SBX environment, *then* it should successfully calculate costs using the manual pricing data without attempting web scraping

*Technical Implementation Notes:* * Update lambda function in [lambda|vscode-file://vscode-app/Applications/Visual%20Studio%20Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-sandbox/workbench/workbench.html] to bypass [get_price_list()|vscode-file://vscode-app/Applications/Visual%20Studio%20Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-sandbox/workbench/workbench.html] web scraping
 * Create new SQL script in [postgres-schema|vscode-file://vscode-app/Applications/Visual%20Studio%20Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-sandbox/workbench/workbench.html] for manual pricing data insertion
 * Pricing data should be sourced from AWS pricing pages with GovCloud filter applied for Amazon and Anthropic models
 * Maintain existing database schema and cost calculation logic

description: For Tushar Dode.
